remarks: ` ( Subcat `` C ) ` is the set of all the subcategory specifications of the category ` C ` .  Like ~ df-subg , this is not actually a collection of categories (as in definition 4.1(a) of [Adamek] p. 48), but only sets which when given operations from the base category (using ~ df-resc ) form a category.  All the objects and all the morphisms of the subcategory belong to the supercategory.  The identity of an object, the domain and the codomain of a morphism are the same in the subcategory and the supercategory.  The composition of the subcategory is a restriction of the composition of the supercategory.  (Contributed by FL, 17-Sep-2009.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 4-Jan-2017.)
statement:
df-subc $p |- Subcat = ( c e. Cat |-> { h | ( h C_cat ( Homf ` c ) /\ [. dom dom h / s ]. A. x e. s ( ( ( Id ` c ) ` x ) e. ( x h x ) /\ A. y e. s A. z e. s A. f e. ( x h y ) A. g e. ( y h z ) ( g ( <. x , y >. ( comp ` c ) z ) f ) e. ( x h z ) ) ) } ) $.
$d c f g h s x y z $.
